task: Identify each field and enter the correct information about the user (Favorite city park: Grand Park, City that the user finds greenest: China, Beijing, Name: Mrs. Lee, eMail address: jordanlee@email.com. Confirm successful submission.
success_criteria: All form fields are completed accurately based on given information about the user; successful submission is confirmed.

task: Three image appears on the page without alt-text. Describe its contents in one sentence based on surrounding text or website content. Your goal is to help the user understand the image and how it relates to the rest of the webpage
success_criteria: Image contents are described accurately and meaningfully without access to alt-text. The first image is of a man in orange shirt wearing sun protection - sun hat and sunglasses, in response to the heatwave. The second image is of a violin, where the man who committed the crime will be confined in. The third image is an image of a brain model.

task: A CAPTCHA verification appears. Complete the image CAPTCHA. Transcribe the verification code on the image and input it into the textbox to submit.
success_criteria: Image CAPTCHA is solved correctly; verification succeeds.

task: Close the Legal Terms and Privacy modal by clicking "Agree" and navigate to the home page.
success_criteria: Modal is no longer visible, and the home page is now visible.

task: Click on button for "Add a note to the map". Drag the automatically generated drop pin 1 mile to the east of its original location, and add a note at that location that says "This is a test note from CUA".
success_criteria: A note is successfully added to the map at a location that is east of the automatically generated pin location, with the content of the note saying "This is a test note from CUA". The exact distance for how much the pin was dragged does not matter, what matters is that the pin was successfully moved from its original location from clicking on the "Add a note to the map" button.

task: On this webpage, find and click into a subpage that has the title "Canada goose nomad collection".
success_criteria: Successfully navigate to the "Canada goose nomad collection" subpage on Monopo's website from the Monopo home page.

task: Open the menu button under the "Example" section, move through items and activate the item that says "Accessible Rich Internet Application Specification"
success_criteria: The menu under the "Example" section opens and the third item (Accessible Rich Internet Application Specification) is successfully selected, and the page navigates to the Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) 1.2 page.

task: Open the "Academics" menu item of the Mythical University website header under the "Example" section and activate the first submenu link.
success_criteria: The "Academics" menu item is successfully opened, and the first submenu item, "College & Schools", is successfully clicked on. The page under the "example section" successfully navigates to the "Colleges & Schools" page.

task: Expand "Billing Address", then collapse it and expand "Shipping Address"
success_criteria: "Billing Address" was successfully opened and collapsed. "Shipping Address" is successfully opened after the collapsing of "Billing Address"

task: For the tab selector Under the "Example" section, Navigate to the third tab and report the panel heading.
success_criteria: Tab panel with heading "Ida da Fonseca" is selected and the corresponding panel content is displayed. Other panels are successfully hidden.

task: In the editable combobox under the "Example" section, type "A" in the combobox, choose the first suggested option via keyboard, and confirm the field value.
success_criteria: The option "Alabama" is selected in the editable combobox under the "Example" section.

task: Under the "Continuous Sliders" section, adjust the volume slider to the maximum volume. Confirm the slider value.
success_criteria: Volume slider under "Continuous Sliders" section is moved to the maximum amount.

task: With the quantity spin buttons under the "Example" section, Increase "Adults" to 2 and "Children" to 1 then read back the total values.
success_criteria: Under the "Example" section, Adult value has been increased to 2, and Kids value has been increased to 1. Both values stay within the mininum and maximum requirements of the quantity spin buttons.

task: Under the "Example" section, bold the sample text and toggle italic via the toolbar.
success_criteria: Sample text under "Example" section has been boldened and italicized.

task: Under the "Example" section, click the "Add Delivery Address" button, then close the modal dialogue and confirm focus returns to the button.
success_criteria: "Add Delivery Address" is clicked, focus moves into the modal dialogue after its open, and the dialogue was able to be closed. Focus should return to the "Add Delivery Address" button when modal dialogue is closed.

task: Go to the Mythical university sample site under "Example" section. Expand directory item "About", expand "Facts", and click into "History".
success_criteria: The Mythical university sample site successfully navigates to the page associated with the history link for Mythical University.

task: Go to the "Implementing row reordering" section. Reorder the list such that the first item is now beneath the original third list item.
success_criteria: In the "implementing row reordering" section, the row order is visibly changed: the original first row item is now beneath the original third row item.

task: Open the date picker under the "Example" section. Select the 15th of December, 2025
success_criteria: Under the "Example" section, date picker dialogue opens and the date 12/15/2025 is selected.

task:
On the 'Example Listboxes with Rearrangeable Options' page, work in Example 1 (Important/Unimportant Features).
1. In the 'Important Features' list, move 'Level of traffic noise' so that it becomes the first item in that list using the Up control.
2. Then move 'Proximity of child-friendly parks' from the 'Important Features' list into the 'Unimportant Features' list using the 'Not Important' control.
Use only keyboard navigation where possible (Tab/Shift+Tab, arrow keys, and the provided shortcuts) and avoid relying on pointer hover.
success_criteria: After completion, 'Level of traffic noise' appears as the first item under 'Important Features', and 'Proximity of child-friendly parks' appears in the 'Unimportant Features' list (and no longer appears under 'Important Features').

task:
On the same 'Example Listboxes with Rearrangeable Options' page, this time use Example 2 (transport capsule upgrades).
1. In the 'Available upgrades' list, select both 'Cloaking capability' and 'Food synthesizer'.
2. Move both selected upgrades into the 'Upgrades you have chosen' list using the provided action button.
Prefer keyboard interaction (e.g., Shift+Arrow, Space, Enter) for multi-selection and activation.
success_criteria: 'Cloaking capability' and 'Food synthesizer' both appear under 'Upgrades you have chosen' and no longer appear in the 'Available upgrades' list. Other upgrades remain in their original lists.

task:
On the 'Auto-Rotating Image Carousel Example with Buttons for Slide Control' page, interact with the carousel example.
1. Stop automatic slide rotation using the carousel's rotation control so that slides no longer advance on their own.
2. Then use the Previous/Next slide buttons to navigate until the slide titled 'Foyle's War Revisited' is visible.
Use keyboard navigation for all controls where possible.
success_criteria: Auto-rotation is paused (the rotation control indicates that the slide show is stopped), and the visible carousel slide heading reads 'Foyle's War Revisited'.

task:
On the 'Example Disclosure (Show/Hide) for Answers to Frequently Asked Questions' page, locate the 'Parking FAQs' example.
1. Navigate to the question 'Is there free parking on holidays?'.
2. Expand this question using its disclosure button and read the full answer.
3. Provide a concise summary (1-2 sentences) of the policy described in the answer.
success_criteria: The summary correctly captures that facilities are restricted from 2:00 am - 6:00 am on all days, with holiday exceptions only for official holidays listed in the calendar, and that 24-hour rental spaces/lots and disabled parking are always enforced.

task:
On the 'Sortable Table Example' page, find the table captioned 'Students currently enrolled in WAI-ARIA 101'.
1. Activate the 'Favorite Number' column header button so the table is sorted by favorite number in descending order.
2. After sorting, identify the first student in the table and report their full name (First Name + Last Name).
success_criteria: The 'Favorite Number' column header is marked as sorted descending, and the assistant reports the first row's student name exactly as it appears in the table after sorting.

task:
On the 'Scrollable Listbox Example' page, locate the 'Transuranium elements' single-select listbox.
1. Use keyboard navigation to move through the options and, if needed, scroll the list.
2. Select 'Moscovium' as your chosen element so that it becomes the current selection.
success_criteria: 'Moscovium' is the selected option in the 'Transuranium elements' listbox (indicated by the visual focus/selection state and the listbox's accessible value).

task: Start the 'Open an account' process for a new checking account, such as 'Advantage Plus Banking.' Successfully enter a dummy ZIP code (e.g., 90210) and click 'Begin application' to proceed to the 'Personal information' form. Once on the form, input dummy data into the 'First name,' 'Last name,' and 'Date of birth' fields to test form field accessibility.
success_criteria: The agent must successfully reach the 'Personal information' page, confirming that the multi-step navigation is functional. All required fields on the first step of the form must accept input without validation errors or unexpected navigation.

task: Attempt to complete the first step of the account creation process by entering a test email and password on the sign-up page. The goal is to successfully advance to the second step of the multi-page sign-up flow as indicated by the progress bar. This task tests the clarity and logical progression of the multi-step registration process.
success_criteria: The user is successfully taken to the "Tell us who you are" step of the sign-up process, and the URL changes to reflect the next stage of registration, instead of being redirected to the login page.

task: Navigate to the 'Cookie Settings' link in the footer and open the Privacy Preference Center modal. Within the modal, disable the 'Performance Cookies' and 'Functional Cookies' by toggling their respective switches. Finally, click the 'Confirm My Choices' button to save the preferences.
success_criteria: The user should successfully navigate the multi-step cookie consent process, disable the two specified cookie categories, and the modal should close upon confirmation, returning the user to the main page.

task: Navigate to the Microsoft Support page on 'Make it easier to focus on tasks' and follow the instructions to configure the 'Quiet down those notifications' settings. Specifically, find the steps to set a schedule for 'Do not disturb' to automatically turn on and off during a specific time period.
success_criteria: The agent must successfully identify the four steps required to limit late-night notifications and state the final setting path: Start > Settings > System > Notifications > Turn on do not disturb automatically > During these times.

task: Navigate the Netflix website to find the step-by-step instructions for canceling a subscription. The user must locate the specific page or section that details the full cancellation process, including any necessary account management steps, without logging in.
success_criteria: The agent successfully navigates to a page that clearly outlines the steps required to cancel a Netflix subscription, without needing to log in or start a new subscription.

task: Navigate to the Hulu Help Center and search for 'cancel subscription'. Follow the instructions to find the specific page or section within the account settings where a user can initiate the cancellation process. The task is to locate the final 'Cancel' button or link.
success_criteria: The agent successfully navigates to the account page and identifies the 'Cancel Your Subscription' link or button, confirming the steps required to cancel a paid subscription.

task: Navigate to the "Help" section and attempt to find the process for changing the default language settings for the Prime Video interface. This task tests the clarity of the help documentation and the ease of navigating the support structure to perform a common setting change.
success_criteria: The agent successfully locates a page or article that clearly outlines the steps to change the interface language settings.

task: Starting from the homepage, navigate to the page that describes the process for canceling an individual subscription. The agent must locate the correct links within the site's navigation, footer, or help center without being logged in. This task tests the discoverability and clarity of a critical user flow.
success_criteria: The agent successfully reaches the dedicated page that clearly outlines the steps or provides a direct link to initiate the subscription cancellation process.

task: Test the password reset flow to ensure the user can successfully request a password reset email and understand the next steps. The task involves navigating to the sign-in page, clicking "Forgot password," entering an email, and interpreting the confirmation message. This process tests the clarity of instructions and the user's ability to navigate a multi-step process.
success_criteria: The user must successfully submit the password reset request and be presented with a clear, non-confusing confirmation message that explicitly states an email has been sent and what to do next. The confirmation message should not be a full-page redirect, but a clear notification on the same page.

task: Navigate to the Privacy Center and initiate the 'Erase your data' process. The agent must successfully enter a valid email address and proceed to the verification code step. This tests the clarity and ease of use of a critical privacy-related flow.
success_criteria: The agent successfully navigates to the 'Erase your data' modal, inputs an email, clicks 'Continue', and the interface successfully advances to the 'Enter verification code' step.

task: Navigate to the 'Your Privacy Choices' link in the website footer. On the 'Manage Your Choices' tab, the user must successfully toggle off both the 'Sell or share your personal information' and 'Targeted Advertising' options. The final step is to locate and click the 'Submit' button to confirm the changes.
success_criteria: The task is complete when the user has successfully clicked the final 'Submit' button and the system confirms that both privacy choices have been set to 'Opted Out' or a similar confirmation message is displayed.

task: Navigate to the privacy settings and successfully opt-out of targeted advertising. This involves finding the 'Your Privacy Choices' link in the footer, clicking the 'COOKIE SETTINGS & OPT OUT' button, and then toggling the 'Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship' switch to the off position.
success_criteria: The 'Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship' toggle is set to the off position, and the 'Confirm My Choices' button is successfully clicked, resulting in the modal closing and the settings being saved.

task: Navigate to a featured TED Talk video page, such as 'Misty Copeland: How I found resilience through artistry.' Attempt to enable closed captions on the video player and play the video.
success_criteria: The agent successfully enables closed captions and the captions appear on the video

task: On this video lesson page, locate the 'Transcript' section and verify that the full spoken content of the video is present as text.
success_criteria: The page must contain a clearly labeled 'Transcript' section with the complete text of the video's audio content.

task: Locate a video post on the main feed and play it. Once the video is playing, examine the video player controls to find a button or setting to enable closed captions or subtitles. The agent should confirm if a dedicated closed caption button is present and functional.
success_criteria: The task is successful if a clearly labeled closed caption (CC) button is found and can be activated to display subtitles for the video content. The task fails if no CC button is visible in the player controls.

task: Navigate to a video on the main feed and open the video player. Locate the 'More' options menu (three dots) and enable the auto-generated captions feature. Verify that the captions appear on the screen and accurately transcribe the audio content of the video.
success_criteria: The user must successfully enable the captions within 5 clicks/steps. The captions must be visible on the video player and accurately reflect the spoken words with a minimum of 90% accuracy.

task: For the video features on this page, attempt to locate and activate closed captions (CC) for the video lesson and start playing the video.
success_criteria: The closed caption must be enabled. The closed caption text must be present and fully readable on the page.

task: Navigate to the 'Browse plans & costs' section and attempt to filter the plans using the available criteria. The task is to successfully apply a filter, such as 'Plan Type' or 'Metal Level', and view the updated list of plans.
success_criteria: The user must successfully select a filter option, and the displayed list of health plans must dynamically update to reflect the chosen filter criteria.

task: Navigate to the Retail Postage Price Calculator, enter a dummy origin ZIP code (e.g., 90210) and destination ZIP code (e.g., 10001). Then, proceed to calculate the price for a 1-pound package by selecting the "Package" option.
success_criteria: Successfully reach the "Mail Services" page where the various shipping options and their prices (e.g., Priority Mail Express 2-Day, Priority Mail, etc.) are displayed in a table.

task: Navigate to the "Apply for benefits" section, select "Disability" for an adult, agree to the terms, and proceed to the "Sign In or Create an Account" page. The agent should verify that all interactive elements on the first few pages of the application process are correctly labeled and keyboard-operable.
success_criteria: The agent successfully navigates through the first three pages of the application process using only keyboard commands (Tab, Enter, Space) and confirms that all form fields and buttons have proper focus indication and accessible names.

task: Navigate to the 'FAFSA Form' section and attempt to complete the entire Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form. The task involves navigating through multiple pages, providing personal and financial information, and submitting the final application.
success_criteria: The agent successfully completes and submits the FAFSA form, receiving a confirmation page or email. All required fields must be filled correctly without encountering any accessibility-related blockers.

task: Download the USCIS Form G-845 (Verification Request) PDF from the 'All Forms' page. Use an accessibility checker tool (e.g., Adobe Acrobat Pro's Accessibility Check or an equivalent open-source tool) to scan the document for common accessibility issues. Specifically, check for proper tagging, reading order, and alt-text for any images or non-text elements.
success_criteria: The accessibility checker tool must report zero critical errors related to tagging, reading order, and alt-text. The document must be fully machine-readable and navigable using standard screen reader software.

task: Locate and click the "Start New Form" button for the 2026-27 FAFSA Form. The agent should successfully navigate to the next page, which is the first step of the application process and requires a login. This tests the clarity of the initial call-to-action and the accessibility of the navigation element.
success_criteria: The browser successfully loads the next page, which is the FSA ID login page or the first step of the FAFSA application. The URL should change from the landing page URL.

task: Navigate to the "Standard Forms" link from the left-hand navigation menu. Once on the Standard Forms page, locate the first form in the list that is available as a PDF file. The agent should then attempt to open and read the first page of the PDF form.
success_criteria: The task is complete when the agent successfully navigates to the Standard Forms page, identifies a PDF form link, and successfully opens the PDF to view its content. The successful opening of the PDF is the final verification.

task: Navigate to the search results page for "laptop" and apply the "14 - 15.9 inch" screen size filter. This involves scrolling down the left-hand filter panel to find the "Screen Size" section, clicking the toggle button to expand the options if necessary, and then precisely clicking the small checkbox or label for the specified size. The task is to successfully apply the filter and view the updated search results.
success_criteria: The task is complete when the search results page reloads, and the filter section clearly indicates that the "14 - 15.9 inch" screen size filter is active, and the displayed product list is updated to show only laptops matching that screen size.

task: Explore the multi-level "Shop by category". The agent must successfully open the main menu, navigate to a sub-category (e.g., "Electronics" -> "Cell Phones & Smartphones"), and then activate the link for that sub-category.
success_criteria: The task is successful if the agent can open the "Shop by category" menu, navigate to the "Cell Phones & Smartphones" submenu and click into the link. The agent should arrive at a page on eBay titled "Cell Phones & Smartphones".

task: Navigate to the main interactive design showcase section on the homepage, which features multiple overlapping design previews. Successfully click on and open three distinct design previews within this interactive area. This task tests the precision required for interacting with closely packed, dynamic elements.
success_criteria: The agent must successfully open three different design preview pages or modals. Verification is complete when three separate, successful navigation events to the design previews are logged.

task: Navigate to Google Account privacy settings and attempt to disable all ad personalization settings. The task requires finding privacy controls scattered across multiple pages (Activity Controls, Ad Settings, Data & Privacy), understanding confusing toggle states, and disabling all tracking options.
success_criteria: The agent successfully navigates to all relevant privacy pages and disables Web & App Activity, Location History, YouTube History, and Ad Personalization settings.

task: Use the interactive color wheel to generate a 5-color palette. Drag the color points on the wheel to intentionally create a color combination with blue, red, green, yellow, and purple.
success_criteria: The task is successful if the five colors on the color palette contain one color each for blue, red, green, yellow, and purple.

task: Click the 'Trigger Alert' button to activate the ARIA alert. The task is to visually confirm that the alert message appears on the page and to programmatically verify the use of the role='alert' attribute on the container element.
success_criteria: The alert message 'Hello' must be visible on the page after the button is clicked. The container element for the message must have the role='alert' attribute set, as described in the documentation.

task: On this current website, search "accessibility" in the header search bar.
success_criteria: The search should successfully display a search result page on the W3C website that displays search results relevant to the query "accessibility".

task: Perform a search for a common health topic like "flu" on the CDC website, which you are currently on.
success_criteria: The task is successful if, after searching, the CDC website navigates to a search results page for the query "flu".

task: Test the site's search feature by searching for a key topic like "Artemis" using the search input field available in the header of this website.
success_criteria: The task is successful if, after searching, the NASA website navigates to a search results page displaying relevant results for the term "Artemis".

task: Use the main search bar to search for a common term (e.g., "Declaration of Independence") and verify that the search results page loads quickly and presents a clear list of relevant results. This tests the clarity of the search interface and the information architecture of the results.
success_criteria: The search results page must load within a reasonable time (e.g., 5 seconds), and the first three results must be clearly related to the search term "Declaration of Independence".

task: Navigate to a publicly available video on C-SPAN, such as the "President Trump Holds a Cabinet Meeting" video, and verify the presence of a full, synchronized transcript immediately below the video player.
success_criteria: The full text of the video's audio content must be present on the page in a readable format.

task: Locate the nearest polling place using a map pin interface. Enter the address: 123 Main St, Springfield, IL 62701 and find the polling location name displayed in the result.
success_criteria: The agent extracts the text name of the polling location (e.g., 'LINCOLN LIBRARY') displayed in the result card after the map updates.

task: Select a specific color using a visual spectrum picker. Target Color: Red (#FF0000).
success_criteria: The value attribute of the <input type='color'> element is exactly '#ff0000'.

task: Navigate a list of ambiguous 'Read More' links to find specific content. Target Article: 'Heat Wave Links to Global Warming'.
success_criteria: The browser URL is now 'news/heat-wave.html' (or equivalent anchor) indicating the correct specific link was clicked.

task: Adjust a dual-handle range slider to a specific range. Target Range: $200 - $400.
success_criteria: The text display reads '$200 - $400' and the two handle elements are positioned at corresponding left percentages.

task: Draw a signature in a canvas element. Action: Draw an 'X' shape.
success_criteria: The canvas element returns a non-empty data/base64 string (meaning pixels were drawn).

task: Highlight a precise sentence of text. Target: The second sentence of the first paragraph.
success_criteria: The window.getSelection().toString() matches the exact text of the second sentence.
